conversations.description: New user onboarding: explaining how GrantScout will fetch, parse, and match grants to the researcher’s profile.
User asks to set up a weekly grant search for their climate‑change lab and provides the lab’s focus and location.
Researcher requests a list of NIH R01 opportunities that match their previous grant history and project keywords.
Non‑profit director wants to see all foundation grants under $50k for education programs in the Midwest.
User asks GrantScout to filter out grants that require a minimum of 3 years of prior funding experience.
Scientist asks for an email draft summarizing the top three EU Horizon Europe calls relevant to synthetic biology.
User wants to schedule a daily check for new NSF SBIR opportunities and receive instant Slack notifications.
Graduate student asks for a draft outline for a DOE Energy Frontier Research Center application.
University research office asks GrantScout to bulk‑import profiles for ten faculty members and run a batch eligibility scan.
User complains about a missing deadline and asks GrantScout to verify the current deadline for a specific NSF grant.
Principal investigator requests a side‑by‑side comparison of two similar grants from different agencies.
Non‑profit admin wants to see if a new grant from the Gates Foundation aligns with their COVID‑19 response program.
User asks GrantScout to prioritize grants with travel allowances for conference attendance.
Research coordinator asks for a summarized CSV export of all eligible grants for the past month.
User requests a reminder email 48 hours before the application deadline for a specific grant.
Faculty member wants to know which grants require a letter of intent and the due date for that step.
User asks to add a new research focus (machine learning for healthcare) to their profile and rerun the match.
GrantScout explains why a certain grant is excluded because the applicant’s institution is not a U.S. entity.
User asks for a concise one‑page pitch deck outline for a grant that demands an impact statement.
Research lab wants to see historical success rates for a particular grant program before applying.
User requests a list of grants that explicitly encourage collaborations with industry partners.
GrantScout notifies a user about a newly posted grant that matches their profile and offers to generate an outline.
User asks to pause the weekly grant monitoring while on sabbatical and reactivate it later.
Non‑profit asks whether a specific grant permits indirect cost rates above 15%.
User wants a quick summary of eligibility criteria for a large EU research infrastructure grant.
Faculty member asks for a draft budget template matching the guidelines of a particular NSF grant.
Research coordinator asks GrantScout to tag each grant with required documentation (e.g., IRB approval).
User wants to know if a grant allows co‑PI institutions from different countries.
GrantScout provides a timeline view of upcoming deadlines for all matched grants over the next six months.
User asks to customize the email notification format to include only title, deadline, and amount.
Research group asks for a list of grants that specifically fund pilot studies.
User wants to add a new funding agency URL to be monitored and asks GrantScout to start scraping it.
GrantScout explains how it parses a complex HTML table from a government portal to extract grant data.
User asks for a bilingual (English/Spanish) grant summary for a foundation that serves Latin America.
Principal investigator wants a draft narrative section addressing the societal impact requirement of a grant.
User requests to flag a grant as “high priority” and have it highlighted in future emails.
Non‑profit asks if a grant allows cost‑sharing and what percentage is required.
User wants a comparison of grant amounts across multiple agencies for similar research topics.
GrantScout suggests a follow‑up action plan after a user’s application is submitted.
User asks to see which grants have already been stored in the system and their current status.
Research admin wants to schedule a monthly report that lists new eligible grants and their deadlines.
User asks GrantScout to filter out grants that require a minimum of 5 publications in the last 3 years.
Faculty member wants a brief justification paragraph for why their project fits the grant’s thematic area.
User requests a quick check if a specific grant is still open after a recent extension announcement.
GrantScout alerts a user that a previously recommended grant has been cancelled and suggests alternatives.
User asks to generate a cover letter template tailored to the funding agency’s style guide.
Research team wants to know if a grant supports equipment purchases and the maximum allowable amount.
User asks GrantScout to merge two similar grant entries that were split across different pages.
Non‑profit director requests a quick audit of all pending grant applications and their current progress.
User wants to receive grant recommendations via a mobile push notification instead of email.
GrantScout explains how eligibility is scored using the user profile and grant criteria.
User asks for a draft project timeline that aligns with the milestones required by a particular grant.
Research coordinator wants to see a heatmap of funding opportunities by geographic region for their field.
User requests a list of grants that specifically fund early‑career investigators in computational biology.
GrantScout confirms that a user’s organization meets the citizenship requirement for a U.K. research council grant.
